newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine to start daily T-bill sales soon-c.bank.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine to start daily T-bill sales soon-c.bank.

text.p: Ukraine will begin selling Treasury bills on a daily basis on the primary market soon in an attempt to lower yields, the central bank chief said on Monday.
"Right now we are readying an electronic system for daily auctions of Treasury bills, and it's evident we can start using it in 10 days," Viktor Yushchenko told a news conference.
He said the new schedule would enable yields to fall to an average of 25 percent in 1997, equal to this year's forecast inflation rate, from 35-50 percent currently.
"Primary auctions should take place on a daily basis with the sale of smaller amounts of paper -- or else the cost goes up for the government," he said.
Until now the bank has auctioned the three-, six-, nine- and 12-month discount T-bills for the Finance Ministry on Tuesdays and Thursdays.
